description: You are given an undirected tree with n nodes labeled from 0 to n - 1, and rooted at node 0. You are given a 2D integer array edges of length n - 1, where edges[i] = [ai, bi] indicates that there is an edge between nodes ai and bi in the tree. You are also given a 0-indexed integer array cost of length n, where cost[i] is the cost assigned to the ith node. You need to place some coins on every node of the tree. The number of coins to be placed at node i can be calculated as: Return an array coin of size n such that coin[i] is the number of coins placed at node i.
